title: PHPsinh()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPsinh()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example Return the hyperbolic sine of different numbers: "); echo(sinh(-3) . "
"); echo(sinh(0) . "
"); echo(sinh(M_PI) . "
"); echo(sinh(M_PI_2)); ?> Definition and Usage The sinh() function returns the hyperbolic sine of a number, which is equal to (exp(number) - exp(-number))/2). Syntax sinh( number ); Parameter Values Parameter Description number Required. Specifies a number Technical Details Return Value: The hyperbolic sine of number Return Type: Float PHP Version: 4.1+ ★ +1

quiz.question: What is which?
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of which is 'equal to (exp(number) - exp(-number))/2)'.

summary: This tutorial covers PHPsinh()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPsinh()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPsinh()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
